contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Eemnes |image_skyline = Zicht op Eemnes3.jpg | image_flag = Vlag Eemnes.jpg | flag_size = 120x100px | image_shield = Eemnes wapen.svg | shield_size = 100x100px |image_map = Dutch Municipality Eemnes 2006.png |mapsize = 250px |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NL |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]] |leader_title = [[burgemeester|Mayor]] |leader_name = [[Roland van Benthem]] |leader_party = [[People's Party for Freedom and Democracy|VVD]] |area_footnotes = (2006) |area_total_km2 = 33.67 |area_land_km2 = 31.03 |area_water_km2 = 2.64 |population_as_of = 1 January, 2007 |population_note = Source: [[Statistics Netherlands|CBS]], [http://statline.cbs.nl/ Statline]. |settlement_type = Municipality |population_total = 8899 |population_density_km2 = 287 |timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset = +1 |timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST = +2 |latd = 52.25 |latNS = N |longd = 5.27 |longEW = E |website = [http://www.eemnes.nl www.eemnes.nl] }} '''Eemnes''' ({{IPA-nl|eɪ̯m.ˈnɛs|-|Nl-Eemnes.ogg}}) is a municipality and a town in the [[Netherlands]], in the province of [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]]. ==The town of Eemnes == Eemnes formerly consisted of two villages, Eemnes-Binnen ("Inner Eemnes") and Eemnes-Buiten ("Outer Eemnes"). These names referred to the location of the villages with respect to the dyke of the river [[Eem]]. Eemnes-Buiten received [[City rights in the Netherlands|city rights]] in 1345; Eemnes-Binnen was granted city rights in 1439. == Pools == Until 1932, when the [[Afsluitdijk]] sealed off the Zuiderzee from the [[North Sea]], the weak dykes in this part of the country would occasionally break during storms. This resulted in the formation of pools, which in Dutch are called "''waaien''" or "''wielen''". Because they could be tens of meters in diameter and several metres deep, landowners often did not make the effort of filling them up. Because they symbolize man's battle against the sea and are relatively rare, provincial authorities designated them "geological monuments" in June 2005.<ref>Marlet, George (June 23, 2005). ''Pareltjes in het landschap van de Eem''. Trouw (newspaper), p. 7.</ref> [[Image:Church eemnes NL.jpg|thumb|none|Church in Eemnes-Binnen]] ==References== {{Reflist}} * Statistics are taken from the [http://www.sdu.nl/staatscourant/gemeentes/gem139u.htm SDU Staatscourant] == External links== {{commons category}} *[http://www.eemnes.nl Official website] {{Geographic location | Centre = Eemnes | Northeast = ''[[Gooimeer]]'' / [[Zeewolde]] ([[Flevoland|FL]]) | East = [[Bunschoten]] | South = [[Baarn]] | West = [[Laren]] ([[North Holland|NH]]) | Northwest = [[Blaricum]] ([[North Holland|NH]]) }} {{Utrecht Province}} [[Category:Municipalities of Utrecht (province)]] [[Category:Populated places in Utrecht (province)]]
